title: Spread of Measles Accelerates, With 465 U.S. Cases So Far This Year
summary: CDC says illness is found in 19 states, with majority of cases tied to outbreak in New York City. The spread of measles is accelerating in the U.S., driven mostly by an outbreak in New York City, data released Monday show, signaling the difficulties public-health officials are confronting as they try to stop the spread of the highly contagious disease.

title: The Temptations Are Hitting Record High Notes on Broadway
summary: 'Ain't Too Proud' grossed $1.3 million for the week ended this past Sunday, its best seven-day period to date, according to the Broadway League. "Ain't Too Proud," the new Broadway jukebox biomusical chronicling the hit-making Motown group the Temptations, is making a big statement at the box office.

title: California Rep. Eric Swalwell Announces 2020 Democratic Presidential Campaign
summary: Crowded field of candidates sees 18th entrant, third younger than 40. WASHINGTON-Rep. Eric Swalwell of California opened a long-shot bid for the Democratic presidential nomination, injecting youth and a prosecutor's zeal into the crowded 2020 field.

title: Libyan Warlord's Aircraft Attack Tripoli Airport, Defying U.S. Pressure
summary: Battle between adversaries light on heavy weapons threatens to return country to civil war; 'it's a balance of weakness'. CAIRO-Forces loyal to Gen. Khalifa Haftar carried out an airstrike against the Libyan capital's only functioning airport, as the rogue military commander defied U.S. calls to halt an assault on Tripoli.

title: All Bernie's Socialists
summary: The candidate's advisers want America to be more like Venezuela..

title: 'Equal Death Day': May 3, 2030
summary: Another unequal fact of life: Men are more likely to be killed on the job.. Last Tuesday was "Equal Pay Day." This unofficial holiday was first declared in 1996 to protest the "wage gap" between the sexes. In the latest data, according to proponents, American women who work full time earned only 80 cents for each $1 earned by men. Hence, to catch up with a man's pay from 2018, a woman must keep working until roughly April 2.

title: More Reality Recognition on Iran
summary: Labeling the IRGC a terrorist organization is simple truth-telling..

title: Man Arrested for Allegedly Plotting Truck Terror Attack in Washington Area
summary: Maryland man was inspired by Islamic State, according to authorities. WASHINGTON-A Maryland man was arrested for allegedly planning to use a stolen rental truck to mow down pedestrians at a popular Washington-area dining and shopping destination in a plot inspired by the terrorist group Islamic State, authorities said.

title: 'Big Business' Review: What Socialism Gets Wrong
summary: It sounds almost sophomoric to say it, but big business has its virtues. It makes most of what we consume, and it gives most of us our jobs.. Opinion polls showing that present-day Democrats look more favorably on socialism than capitalism have prompted Tyler Cowen, an economics professor at George Mason University, to write what he calls a "love letter" to big business. His thesis: Corporations may lack heroic attributes, but they deserve more respect than they get.

title: Many Unhappy Trump Returns
summary: Democrats think they can embarrass the President over his tax secrecy..

title: Conservatives, Resist the Tribal Temptation
summary: American ideals are open to all. Embracing the left's racial essentialism is a serious mistake.. Modern liberalism has broken from its roots by focusing on groups rather than individuals, reimagining Western history as irredeemably corrupt, and celebrating victimhood. The danger is not only that the new left might win in the marketplace of ideas, but that conservatives will pervert their own beliefs in response.

title: Make-Believe Meat and the Future
summary: Shamburgers won't replace steaks, but perhaps they'll ease global warming a bit.. Last weekend I faced up to the 21st century. I walked into a hamburger emporium and ordered an Impossible Burger with all the trimmings.

title: Cheating on the SATs
summary: How is what Harvard does different from the charges against Felicity Huffman?. The story has it all: wealth, celebrity, big-name universities-and cheating.

title: Chinese Woman Arrested at Mar-a-Lago Had Cache of Electronics
summary: Authorities say she had device to detect hidden cameras, $8,000 in U.S. and Chinese currency. WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.-A Chinese woman arrested for entering President Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort without authorization had $8,000 in U.S. and Chinese currency and a cache of electronic devices in her hotel room, according to a prosecutor who spoke at the woman's detention hearing.

title: If You Drive, You Should Pay
summary: America's roads are crumbling. The best way to save them is by imposing tolls.. Rebuilding America's interstate highway system would cost $57 billion a year over two decades, according to an expert committee appointed by the Transportation Research Board. It gets worse. By the panel's own estimates, all that rebuilding would leave the highways in considerably worse shape in 2040 than they are today. And this would require raising federal fuel taxes by 360%, a figure the committee left out of the report.

title: An Overdue Apology to Italian-Americans
summary: An enormous, savage mob lynched 11 in 1891 New Orleans.. New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell will officially apologize Friday for the largest mass lynching in U.S. history. On March 14, 1891, the city of New Orleans became a charnel house as a mob of as many as 20,000 wantonly slaughtered 11 Italian-Americans. Some of the victims had been charged in the murder of a police chief, but the trials all ended in acquittal or mistrial. A gang descended on the jail where the men were being held, shot them to death, and displayed their bodies for the savage rabble outside. Southern belles in search of souvenirs dipped their lace handkerchiefs in the blood of the butchered Italians.

title: The Comedian vs. the Hero of Ukraine
summary: Petro Poroshenko, the man who stood up to Putin, deserves better than to be fired at history's whim.. Kiev

title: At Least Three Americans Killed in Afghanistan Blast
summary: Taliban claims responsibility for an improvised device that struck a convoy near Bagram Air Field. WASHINGTON-At least three American service members and a civilian contractor were killed in a Taliban attack on a convoy in Afghanistan on Monday, U.S. military officials said.

title: Tech Hiring Cools in March
summary: U.S. employers across all industries cut 155,000 IT jobs last month, while tech-sector employment rose by 16,000, CompTIA says. Employers across the U.S. economy cut 155,000 information-technology jobs last month, following a sharp upturn in IT hiring in February, according to an analysis of the latest federal employment data by CompTIA Inc.

title: How Will Democrats Explain South Bend?
summary: The search continues for a premise to the Buttigieg candidacy.. Some readers thought it unfair last week when this column described potential Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg as "a small-city mayor with a middling record." This assessment may have been too kind to the media's favorite millennial. Regardless, it appears that the mayor of South Bend, Indiana, is almost ready to announce a 2020 run.

summary: Move comes a day after Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen's departure was announced; she oversaw Secret Service. WASHINGTON-Randolph "Tex" Alles, the director of the U.S. Secret Service, is leaving his post and will be replaced by career Secret Service agent James Murray, the White House said Monday.

title: GE Shares Slump as Top Analyst Downgrades to 'Sell' Again
summary: JPMorgan analyst Stephen Tusa says investors are too optimistic on turnaround, cuts price target to $5 a share. General Electric Co. shares tumbled Monday after the company was downgraded to a "sell" rating by JPMorgan Chase & Co., just four months after the bank upgraded its longtime bearish view.

title: Versum Gets 'Superior' $53/Share Bid From Germany's Merck
summary: Versum had previously planned to combine with Entegris in a stock-swap merger. Versum Materials Inc. on Monday said Merck KGaA has offered to acquire the company for $53 a share, or about $5.78 billion, and that its board determined the bid constitutes a superior proposal to its planned all-stock merger with Entegris Inc.

title: Klobuchar, Booker Each Raised $5 Million for Presidential Campaigns
summary: So far, Sanders leads in fund raising among those seeking the Democratic nomination. WASHINGTON-Sens. Amy Klobuchar and Cory Booker said they each raised about $5 million since starting their Democratic presidential campaigns earlier this year.

summary: Bankrupt luxury chain seeks court approval to liquidate U.S. inventory. Bankrupt women's luxury fashion chain L.K. Bennett USA Inc. said it plans to hold store-closing sales at its U.S. locations and on its website.

WASHINGTON-The Trump administration escalated a pressure campaign against Iran on Monday by designating the country's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a foreign terrorist organization, the first time an element of a foreign state has been officially named a terrorist entity.

summary: Falling industrial shares weigh on indexes Monday, but S&P moves higher in late afternoon. The S&P 500 drifted higher late in the afternoon of a quiet trading session Monday, narrowly avoiding breaking its longest streak of consecutive gains since 2017.

summary: Washington says Turkey's use of the equipment would pose serious security threat. Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Monday his country would forge ahead with the purchase of an air-defense system from Russia despite U.S. warnings that using the equipment would jeopardize Ankara's role within the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

summary: Precidian Funds ETF application will be approved unless commission orders a hearing. Wall Street's top regulator has paved the way for a new kind of exchange-traded fund that won't immediately disclose its investments to the public.

summary: Italian-American auto maker seeks to meet EU carbon-dioxide targets with electric-vehicles deal. Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV plans to count Tesla Inc . electric cars as part of its fleet to avoid significant fines for violating stricter European Union emissions rules.

title: India Police Seek Charges Against Bishop for Alleged Rape
summary: The accusation of raping a nun comes two months after Pope Francis acknowledged wider sexual exploitation of nuns within the Catholic Church. MUMBAI-Indian police said on Monday that they will ask a court to charge a Catholic bishop with raping a nun in the southern state of Kerala, two months after Pope Francis acknowledged wider sexual exploitation of nuns within the Catholic Church.

title: Aramco Bond Sale Flies as Investor Orders Near $60 Billion
summary: Orders far outstrip $10 billion targeted by Saudi oil giant. Aramco has won about $60 billion of orders for its closely watched debut bond sale, far outstripping the $10 billion targeted by the Saudi oil giant, as investors appeared to shrug off its ambitious pricing and early concerns about government influence over the state-backed company.

title: Iran Labels U.S. Central Command a Terrorist Organization
summary: Tehran responds to Trump administration's designation of Revolutionary Guards. Iran designated U.S. forces in the Middle East as a terrorist group in response to the Trump administration branding Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a terrorist organization.

title: Pinterest's Dull Picture Is Uninspired
summary: Image-sharing company's low IPO pricing range could limit returns. Better to underpromise and overdeliver, they say. For Pinterest, this might be bad advice.

title: U.S. Needs a Better Approach to China's Rise
summary: The last 20 years of our neglect and foolish assumptions regarding the intentions and ultimate outcomes of the China dynamic now places the U.S. in a compromised posture on the world stage.. I agree, for all the reasons cited in William Galston's "Is It Too Late to Counter China's Rise?" (Politics & Ideas, April 3) and more, that the last 20 years of our neglect and foolish assumptions regarding the intentions and ultimate outcomes of the China dynamic now place the U.S. in a compromised posture on the world stage, a posture that may soon be irreversible. The U.S. finds itself at an existential inflection point. Without denying the challenges we face at home, China's pursuit of economic and military dominance requires our nation's concerted attention in a manner not seen since World War II-the threat posed by China's ascendancy is that critical. It is playing out a well-crafted strategic game for long-run world hegemony.

title: 'Smallville' Actress Pleads Guilty in Case Involving Cult-Like Group
summary: Allison Mack was high-ranking member of Nxivm, prosecutors say. Actress Allison Mack pleaded guilty to racketeering charges Monday for what federal prosecutors said was her high-ranking role in an upstate New York cult-like group.

title: Golan and Crimea Annexations Are Different
summary: Israel took the Golan as a result of an aggressive war of annihilation started against it by Syria and its Arab allies. Russia seized Crimea for reasons of national interest.. Joseph Lowry's March 30 letter "If Golan to Israel Is OK, How About Crimea?" responding to your editorial "Israel's Golan Heights" (March 22) compares Israel's capture of the Golan with Russia's seizure of Crimea, but this is an apples to oranges false analogy.

title: Let's Do a Better Job Housing Our Military
summary: While military family housing currently has serious and unacceptable issues, we should fix them without returning it to government ownership and management.. I wholeheartedly agree with Sandy Apgar and Mark Cancian that while military family housing currently has serious and unacceptable issues, we should fix them without returning it to government ownership and management ("The Pentagon Shouldn't Be a Landlord," op-ed, April 4).

title: Iran Presents Sanctionable Threats Beyond the JCPOA
summary: Sanctions against Iran for it's support of terrorism, missile program and human-rights abuses should be imposed and remain in place whether the U.S. is in the JCPOA or not.. Mark Dubowitz's concern that certain Democratic candidates, if elected, would rejoin the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action is misplaced ("Build an Iranian Sanctions Wall," op-ed, April 3). He states that the sanctions he suggests "would be directed not against [Iran's] nuclear program but the regime's role as the leading state sponsor of terrorism . . . its missile program . . . and its human-rights abuses." All of these sanctions could, and in my view should, be imposed and remain in place whether the U.S. is in the JCPOA or not.

title: Gov. Pritzker's Ramp and Illinois Tax Math
summary: The worst kept secret in Illinois is that retirement income, including pensions, IRA distributions and Social Security benefits are excluded from state income tax.. Regarding your editorial "Pritzker's Illinois Exit Ramp" (March 16): The worst kept secret in Illinois is that retirement income, including pensions, IRA distributions and Social Security benefits are excluded from state income tax. This exclusion is worth much more to most retirees than the plan to increase the tax rates, and its elimination (which is suggested periodically) would result in roads full of Illini moving to Florida, Nevada and Texas.

title: Weaker Dollar Lifts Gold Prices
summary: Some analysts expect gold and other assets to continue wobbling until fresh earnings or economic data changes the market backdrop. Gold prices climbed Monday, supported by a weaker dollar.

From their first appearance at the end of season 1, they grew from hatchlings into flying, fire-breathing behemoths nearly 125-feet long.

title: How Much Is Your College-Basketball Team Worth?
summary: Kentucky remains the most valuable program in the sport, while the Atlantic Coast Conference has four teams in the top seven. title: Sears Bankruptcy Proves Restructuring Pro's Toughest Assignment Yet
summary: Mohsin Meghji has seen a lot of challenges after 20 years in the business. None compare with Sears.. Mohsin Meghji, a turnaround professional with more than 20 years of experience, has served as chief restructuring officer for many companies over the years.

title: Max Minghella on 'The Handmaid's Tale' and Following His Oscar-Winning Late Father
summary: As the son of Anthony Minghella, 33-year-old Max Minghella says directing "is organic to my personality." Now, after years of practicing in secret, "The Handmaid's Tale" actor goes behind the camera with "Teen Spirit.". "I have always felt very comfortable behind a camera," says Max Minghella, the 33-year-old British-born actor. "I've always felt very uncomfortable in front of one." Not that it shows: The son of famed director Anthony Minghella, Max broke out in 2005's Syriana and later, to bigger acclaim playing Mark Zuckerberg's college enemy Divya Narendra in David Fincher's The Social Network. He's been nominated for an ensemble Screen Actors Guild award twice with the cast of Hulu's The Handmaid's Tale, on which he plays the smoldering but morally ambiguous Nick Blaine.

title: French Press for Tax Cuts as Macron Pressured to Deliver Change
summary: President must produce meaningful legislation as the 'great national debate' ends, but requests reflect polarized state of the French public. PARIS-Months of town hall debates across France have boiled down to demands for tax cuts and more public services in rural areas, according to the French government, an indication of the difficult straits President Emmanuel Macron is navigating as he seeks to quell support for the yellow-vest protest movement.

title: The Rise of the Male Scrunchie
summary: As more guys jump on the long hair trend, they're also embracing a wider range of hair accessories, like the pink Fendi hair tie worn by Aquaman Jason Momoa. Jason Momoa, Hollywood's shaggy-haired He-man, wasn't up for an Oscar this year, but he did notch a very different sort of honor at this February's Academy Awards: most talked-about male scrunchie. And not just any scrunchie but a custom pink-velvet Fendi affair to match his pink-velvet tuxedo. On Mr. Momoa's YouTube channel, he noted that his entire pink Oscars outfit was inspired by a different pink scrunchie that was lent to him by a hairdresser on the set of his upcoming Apple TV show. "I freaked out 'cause it was beautiful," said Mr. Momoa of discovering that initial salmon-colored accessory.

title: California's Wet Winter Could Mean Fewer Wildfires
summary: Forests are the healthiest in years as a drought eases, but officials worry about risk from new hillside blooms. SAN FRANCISCO-California's unusually wet winter has officials hopeful that there will be fewer deadly wildfires in 2019 than last year's series of devastating infernos.

title: Space Is Poised for Explosive Growth. Let's Get It Right.
summary: Before low-earth orbit is clogged with hotels, satellite traffic and debris, we should plan for the extra-planetary community we want, writes Ariel Ekblaw, founder of the MIT Media Lab Space Exploration Initiative. In the 19th century, urban planners wrangled the chaotic metropolises of Paris and New York into "planned cities," turning warrens of streets into orderly grids, building sewage systems and transit lines, and allowing for new types of architecture, such as apartment buildings. Today, we face a similar inflection point in developing the nearest reaches of space.

title: What Pete Buttigieg Tells Us About Changing Times
summary: Young, openly gay military veteran-a potential Democratic presidential candidate-shows demise of old political norms. He either would have been laughed off that stage, or widely ignored.

summary: The NCAA wants to personalize locker rooms at U.S. Bank Stadium-but not all mementos fit into a duffel bag. MINNEAPOLIS-As the men's basketball teams here have learned in recent days, even the locker-room rugs are bigger at the Final Four.

title: BMW to Take Charge as EU Warns of Possible Emissions Collusion
summary: Anticipating a significant fine, German auto maker says it will take €1 billion charge on first-quarter earnings. BMW AG will take a €1 billion charge against first-quarter earnings in the wake of European Union allegations it colluded with other car makers to restrict emissions technology, the German auto maker said.

title: Global Investors Line Up for a Shot of Kerosene-Smelling Chinese Liquor
summary: Forget Alibaba and Tencent, investors are intoxicated by this pungent drink. A Chinese liquor stock has captured the imagination of global investors as a proxy for affluent consumers in the world's second-largest economy.

title: German Car-Parts Maker ZF Expects Higher Tax Burden After Wabco Takeover
summary: Switzerland-based Wabco expects to pay taxes at a rate of 18% this year. German car-parts maker ZF Friedrichshafen AG expects to pay higher taxes for Wabco, once the transaction to purchase the U.S.-listed company closes, said Chief Financial Officer Konstantin Sauer.

title: Facebook, Google in Crosshairs of New U.K. Policy to Control Tech Giants
summary: London's proposal for new social-media regulator is one of the broadest yet in a larger movement by countries to assert control over tech giants. The U.K. government plans to create a regulatory body to force the removal of harmful content from the internet, one of the most far-reaching legislative proposals from a host of countries trying to put a tighter leash on global technology companies.

title: Food Companies Take a Break From the Deal Table
summary: The value of food and beverage M&A in the first quarter was the lowest since 2009. Food and drink companies haven't had much stomach for deals recently. The lull is likely temporary, but it also might be getting harder for executives to rally support for blockbuster transactions.

title: White House Seeks Tighter Grip on Immigration Policy
summary: Tensions that led to Kirstjen Nielsen's ouster presage more departures at Homeland Security. WASHINGTON-President Trump is shaking up the top ranks of the Department of Homeland Security and has instructed White House advisers to take a more direct role implementing immigration policy in an effort to slow the rise in families illegally crossing the southern border.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: OUE Commercial REIT, OUE Hospitality Trust to Merge
summary: Deal creates trust with combined assets worth S$6.8 billion. SINGAPORE-Two Singapore-listed real-estate investment trusts said Monday that they have agreed to merge their businesses and create the eight largest real-estate investment trust in the country by assets.

title: Israeli Election Is Seen as a Referendum on Netanyahu
summary: The Israeli prime minister has helped forge a consensus on the Palestinian territories and security but faces voter fatigue with his decade in office. TEL AVIV-Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's quest to become Israel's longest-serving leader has become a referendum on his decades in public life.

title: Pinterest Is Expected to Set IPO Price Range Below Last Valuation
summary: The image-search company will begin its roadshow Monday. Pinterest Inc. plans to set a price range for its initial public offering that is below where the online image-search company last raised money privately when it begins a roadshow to pitch the shares to investors Monday.

title: How's Your ETF Portfolio Doing? Good Luck Finding Out
summary: Ready-made 'model portfolios' are growing-but there is no standardized tracking of performance, making comparisons difficult. These days it is easy to comparison-shop for everything from sneakers to paper towels. But if you're in the market for a ready-made portfolio of exchange-traded funds-an increasingly popular product with the potential to make or break your finances-it may be a lot tougher.

title: When to Dump a Loser Mutual Fund
summary: Funds in the bottom of the quarterly rankings share some attributes that investors can watch out for. What about the losers?

title: And the No. 1 Stock-Fund Manager Is...
summary: A Fidelity growth fund wins with a 38% performance gain over the past 12 months. What a difference three months can make in the world of top-performing mutual-fund managers.

title: Thankless Duty at Homeland Security
summary: Nielsen takes the blame for the failures of Trump and Congress.. Kirstjen Nielsen's resignation Sunday as secretary of Homeland Security is best understood as a ritual sacrifice for the failures of the American political system on immigration. Ms. Nielsen wasn't responsible for the surge of Central American migrants arriving at the border to claim political asylum, but Donald Trump and Democrats in Congress both needed a fall guy.

title: U.S.-Stock Funds Rose 13% but Bonds Draw Cash
summary: Widespread gains defy predictions that bullish mood would soon end. Everyone's waiting for this stock market to finally tire out, but the first quarter was the latest example of the market saying, "Not yet."

title: The Perils of After-Hours Stock Trading
summary: Perhaps the biggest one: It tempts investors to react to a news event, in hopes of making a quick profit. Stock exchanges technically open and close at certain times of day, but investors can still trade shares of stocks and exchange-traded funds during sessions before the opening and after the close.

title: Tips for Using a Roth IRA to Save for College
summary: Experts answer questions about Roth IRAs, grandparents, scholarships and more. We again asked experts to help answer reader questions on the best way to save for college, including how to use tax-advantaged "529" accounts.

title: Sam Stewart Picks Stocks the Way He Always Has
summary: At 76, the founder of Wasatch Funds is working at a new company, with his sons. But he still believes in growth stocks.. Sam Stewart got hooked on the stock market at an age when he should have been into baseball cards. The son of a stockbroker, Mr. Stewart wasn't yet a teenager when he heard George Romney, then chairman of American Motors Corp., extol the virtues of selling compact cars and told his father, "You need to buy some American Motors stock."

title: A Millennials ETF Does Well, but Can't Escape the Stigma
summary: The fund has outperformed the S&P 500 but attracted few investors. Millennials are an attractive market for many companies. But a fund that focuses on companies that target millennials hasn't attracted much interest from investors, despite impressive returns.

title: A Surprising Connection Between the Bull Market and Stock Buybacks
summary: Buybacks are more important than economic growth when it comes to equity-market performance, study says. Whatever else you may think about stock buybacks, it's quite likely that, but for them, the U.S. stock market today would be markedly lower.

title: The Current Allure of 'Ultrashort' Bond Funds
summary: With the Federal Reserve on hold, and its next move uncertain, investors want to keep their options open. A Federal Reserve policy shift that has created uncertainty over interest rates, is generating renewed interest in ultrashort-term bond funds.

title: Oil-and-Gas ETFs Are Thriving
summary: Supply-side factors that have kept the price of oil relatively high are driving the sector, analysts say. It has been a good year for exchange-traded funds focused on the oil-and-gas industry, though investors should be wary of potential pitfalls, analysts say.

title: A Fund's Long Time Frame: Forever
summary: Akre Focus Fund's managers often hold the same small collection of stocks for years. (AKREX) takes buy-and-hold investing to heart, often holding the same small group of stocks for years at a time.

title: A REIT Fund Preaches 'Common Sense'
summary: The ETF focuses on the location of the properties held by the REITs it invests in. ETF (PPTY) has a surprisingly obvious focus: location.
categories: Spotlight: U.S. Diversified Real Estate ETF

title: Emerging-Markets ETFs Draw Cash
summary: Last year's inflows set a record, and this year is off to a strong start. Investors in exchange-traded funds are more excited about emerging markets than ever.

title: What Is 'Quantamental' Investing?
summary: This stock-picking approach relies on a combination of quantitative and fundamental investing techniques. Investors increasingly may hear the term "quantamental" being used by financial professionals.

title: Trump Administration Officials Back Herman Cain Despite Scrutiny
summary: Federal Reserve Board candidate cited sexual-harassment accusations in Facebook video. WASHINGTON-White House officials on Sunday backed Herman Cain for a seat on the Federal Reserve's board of governors even after the former restaurant executive and onetime GOP presidential candidate warned that he expects renewed scrutiny of sexual-harassment allegations against him.

title: Nielsen's Exit Is Latest Challenge to Immigration Agenda
summary: Trump names U.S. Customs and Border Protection Commissioner Kevin McAleenan as acting secretary. WASHINGTON-Kirstjen Nielsen resigned Sunday as homeland security secretary, adding another challenge for an administration grappling with its core immigration agenda while facing a surge of migrants at the southern border.

title: Baylor Wins NCAA Women's Basketball Championship
summary: The Lady Bears beat defending champion Notre Dame 82-81 to take their third national championship. For the second straight year, Notre Dame found itself in the national championship game trailing by one possession with seconds left to play. In 2018, the Fighting Irish developed a reputation as comeback kids after then-junior Arike Ogunbowale nailed a last-second shot to upset Connecticut in the national semifinal and then did it again two nights later in the final to beat Mississippi State despite trailing by 15 points at the half.

title: Trump Picks Career Border Official for Acting DHS Leader
summary: Kevin McAleenan has acted as an able enforcer, though not an architect, of Mr. Trump's often hard-line approach to illegal immigration. President Trump's pick to lead the Department of Homeland Security, Kevin McAleenan, has acted as an enforcer, though not an architect, of Mr. Trump's often hard-line approach to illegal immigration, including last year's controversial and short-lived policy of separating immigrant parents and children at the border.
